title: Social enquiry: questions, answers and action
creator_contributor_role: Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch, production company
subject_group: Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Decision-making
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Environmental protection - Citizen participation
Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Social sciences - Study and teaching
Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Teaching - Aids and devices
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Social sciences - Study and teaching
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Social action
description: Looks at two classes, one at year 4 and one at year 10, engaged in effective enquiry learning. Both are investigating local issues involving the environment, plus the decision making processes that enable change to take place. Different stages of the enquiry sequence are featured which allow observations to be made about teaching strategies and the learning processes.
